verses.text_plain: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he, and all his host, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it; and they built forts against it round about.
verses.verse_html: 1And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he, and all his host, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it; and they built forts against it round about.

tokens.text: And it came to pass in the ninth

verses.text_plain: And the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
verses.verse_html: 2And the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.

verses.text_plain: And on the ninth day of the fourth month the famine prevailed in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.
verses.verse_html: 3And on the ninth day of the fourth month the famine prevailed in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.

verses.text_plain: And the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between two walls, which is by the king’s garden: (now the Chaldees were against the city round about:) and the king went the way toward the plain.
verses.verse_html: 4And the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between two walls, which is by the king’s garden: (now the Chaldees were against the city round about:) and the king went the way toward the plain.

verses.text_plain: And the army of the Chaldees pursued after the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho: and all his army were scattered from him.
verses.verse_html: 5And the army of the Chaldees pursued after the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho: and all his army were scattered from him.

verses.text_plain: So they took the king, and brought him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment upon him.
verses.verse_html:
6So they took the king, and brought him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment upon him. ▼
▼ gave…: Heb. spake judgment with him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ gave…: Heb. spake judgment with him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ gave…: Heb. spake judgment with him

verses.text_plain: And they slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with fetters of brass, and carried him to Babylon.
verses.verse_html:
7And they slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with fetters of brass, and carried him to Babylon. ▼
▼ put…: Heb. made blind

footnotes.body_html: ▼ put…: Heb. made blind

verses.text_plain: And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzar–adan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, unto Jerusalem:
verses.verse_html:
8And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzar–adan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, unto Jerusalem: ▼
▼ captain…: or, chief marshal

footnotes.body_html: ▼ captain…: or, chief marshal

verses.text_plain: And he burnt the house of the Lord, and the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great man’s house burnt he with fire.
verses.verse_html: 9And he burnt the house of the Lord, and the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great man’s house burnt he with fire.

verses.text_plain: And all the army of the Chaldees, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down the walls of Jerusalem round about.
verses.verse_html: 10And all the army of the Chaldees, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down the walls of Jerusalem round about.

verses.text_plain: Now the rest of the people that were left in the city, and the fugitives that fell away to the king of Babylon, with the remnant of the multitude, did Nebuzar–adan the captain of the guard carry away.
verses.verse_html:
11Now the rest of the people that were left in the city, and the fugitives that fell away to the king of Babylon, with the remnant of the multitude, did Nebuzar–adan the captain of the guard carry away. ▼
▼ fugitives: Heb. fallen away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ fugitives: Heb. fallen away

verses.text_plain: But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.
verses.verse_html: 12But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.

verses.text_plain: And the pillars of brass that were in the house of the Lord, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the Lord, did the Chaldees break in pieces, and carried the brass of them to Babylon.
verses.verse_html: 13And the pillars of brass that were in the house of the Lord, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the Lord, did the Chaldees break in pieces, and carried the brass of them to Babylon.

verses.text_plain: And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.
verses.verse_html: 14And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.

verses.text_plain: And the firepans, and the bowls, and such things as were of gold, in gold, and of silver, in silver, the captain of the guard took away.
verses.verse_html: 15And the firepans, and the bowls, and such things as were of gold, in gold, and of silver, in silver, the captain of the guard took away.

verses.text_plain: The two pillars, one sea, and the bases which Solomon had made for the house of the Lord; the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
verses.verse_html:
16The two pillars, one sea, and the bases which Solomon had made for the house of the Lord; the brass of all these vessels was without weight. ▼
▼ one…: Heb. the one sea

footnotes.body_html: ▼ one…: Heb. the one sea

verses.text_plain: The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and the chapiter upon it was brass: and the height of the chapiter three cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegranates upon the chapiter round about, all of brass: and like unto these had the second pillar with wreathen work.
verses.verse_html: 17The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and the chapiter upon it was brass: and the height of the chapiter three cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegranates upon the chapiter round about, all of brass: and like unto these had the second pillar with wreathen work.

tokens.text: and like unto these had the second

verses.text_plain: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:
verses.verse_html:
18And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door: ▼
▼ door: Heb. threshold

verses.text_plain: And out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war, and five men of them that were in the king’s presence, which were found in the city, and the principal scribe of the host, which mustered the people of the land, and threescore men of the people of the land that were found in the city:
verses.verse_html:
19And out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war, and five men of them that were in the king’s presence, which were found in the city, and the principal scribe of the host, which mustered the people of the land, and threescore men of the people of the land that were found in the city: ▼
▼ officer: or, eunuch
 , ▼
▼ were in…: Heb. saw the king’s face
 , ▼
▼ principal…: or, scribe of the captain of the host

footnotes.body_text: ▼ were in…: Heb. saw the king’s face
footnotes.body_html: ▼ were in…: Heb. saw the king’s face

footnotes.body_text: ▼ principal…: or, scribe of the captain of the host
footnotes.body_html: ▼ principal…: or, scribe of the captain of the host

verses.text_plain: And Nebuzar–adan captain of the guard took these, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah:
verses.verse_html: 20And Nebuzar–adan captain of the guard took these, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah:

verses.text_plain: And the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.
verses.verse_html: 21And the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.

verses.text_plain: And as for the people that remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler.
verses.verse_html: 22And as for the people that remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler.

tokens.text: even over them he made Gedaliah

verses.text_plain: And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.
verses.verse_html: 23And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.

verses.text_plain: And Gedaliah sware to them, and to their men, and said unto them, Fear not to be the servants of the Chaldees: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon; and it shall be well with you.
verses.verse_html: 24And Gedaliah sware to them, and to their men, and said unto them, Fear not to be the servants of the Chaldees: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon; and it shall be well with you.

tokens.text: to them, and to their men

verses.text_plain: But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah, that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldees that were with him at Mizpah.
verses.verse_html:
25But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah, that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldees that were with him at Mizpah. ▼
▼ royal: Heb. of the kingdom

tokens.text: But it came to pass in the seventh
that were with him at Mizpah

footnotes.body_html: ▼ royal: Heb. of the kingdom

verses.text_plain: And all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose, and came to Egypt: for they were afraid of the Chaldees.
verses.verse_html: 26And all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose, and came to Egypt: for they were afraid of the Chaldees.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evil–merodach king of Babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;
verses.verse_html: 27And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evil–merodach king of Babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;

tokens.text: And it came to pass in the seven

verses.text_plain: And he spake kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon;
verses.verse_html:
28And he spake kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon; ▼
▼ kindly…: Heb. good things with him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ kindly…: Heb. good things with him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ kindly…: Heb. good things with him

verses.text_plain: And changed his prison garments: and he did eat bread continually before him all the days of his life.
verses.verse_html: 29And changed his prison garments: and he did eat bread continually before him all the days of his life.

verses.text_plain: And his allowance was a continual allowance given him of the king, a daily rate for every day, all the days of his life.
verses.verse_html: 30And his allowance was a continual allowance given him of the king, a daily rate for every day, all the days of his life.
